message:
Hey all , i'm coding an Android App and i want to trace my App how many user has uninstalled it. is that possible 

or

when the user uninstall the app it forward him to an exact web page .

thanks in advance

data.message: Yes you can, it's common and not hard. try Googling it before posting this question, people here would eat you alive for that :D
i'd tried alot of answers on stack and it's still not working

No, I don't think you can, ACTION_PACKAGE_REMOVED broadcast will be sent to all other apps on your system except for your uninstalled app.
Google Play though, does give you insights about the number of installed/uninstalled users.
So the expected behavior is that once the user uninstalls the app, Chrome will suddenly open a web page? Do you think this is an acceptable behavior in the first place?
Ahmed Ibrahim Khalil i guess there's a work around to have an independent service in the background installed separated from the app
Ahmed Mabrook Since your service is written inside the AndroidManifest.xml of your application, it will be uninstalled as well.
As it will open a servey to ask the user what is the matter with the application to improve it i think it's  acceptable

Acceptability is not a matter of what you as a developer want to achieve. It is a matter of what users find acceptable. Personally, as an Android user, I would report an app that employs such invasive tactics.

Muhammad Mustafa
And why would a user waste his time on your survey especially after he wasted his time with your application ?

I just want to know how many user has uninstalled my app i don't need to know anything  else

I wouldn't  trace anything else :) i can do it btw but i'll put a very critical  permission  which i refused to put it in my app :))
That piece info is available in the Google Play developer console.
In alpha and beta versions the possibility  of uninstalling app is very high i want to know why he uninstalled it to do the exact  improvement  in the app
You have changed your mind twice so far. What is it exactly that you want to do?
And as for alpha/bet versions and improvements, that is usually done via testers, you do not release your app into the wild and then ask people what they think *after* they uninstall it.
I am sure you can. There is an ad network that can display an ad or a survey when a user uninstall your app. Check it and see how it is working: http://www.appjolt.com

After investigating Hisham Hassan's answer.
I found a good approach in this answer[1], but you will have to add the GET_TASKS permission, and I don't think it is 100% working across all devices. 

[1] http://stackoverflow.com/a/18816716/429962
